docs.title: Welcome to diego-utils
docs.text:
This site contains both the package documentation for diego-utils and my "playbook" for Data Science. diego-utils is a Python package with some useful utility functions for data science and econometrics. The "playbook" part of this site covers several Data Science aspects including:

  • Git and sustainability considerations
  • Useful Python bits, including my style guide
  • Some thoughts on managing a Data Science Project

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: In order to use the diego-utils package, you will need to have at least Python 3.11. To install the package and be able to use the functions in it, you will need to follow the following instructions:

docs.title: Set Up 🛫
docs.text: As of right now, there are no extra bits of code, that will be coming soon.

docs.title: Git and Sustainability
docs.text:
This site will cover Git and GitHub, including topics like:

  • Getting Started with Git
  • Useful Git commangs and workflow ideas
  • Setting up GitHub repos and options
  • Managing Branches and deployment strategies
  • GitHub Actions and Continous Improvement

docs.title: High Level Overview
docs.text: This site is useful to provide some background on how to use this site and the diego-utils package. It also gives some Thoughts on where to start.

docs.title: Data Science Projects
docs.text: This section will cover my thoughts on how to set-up and manage Data Science projects

docs.title: Overview of the Python Guidance
docs.text: This page covers some of my thoughts on how to build Python based data science projects. It will give explanations of how to use the code in the diego-utils package. It will also include my personal style guide and other things I think are important when using Python as a dev language.
